info.description: The DM Administration API uses the specificationVersion schema for publishing administrative messages for any changed data in the complete set of operations definition objects. DM Administration API provides the ability to create, change, or delete the an element, partial set or complete set of definitions for mine operations and its supply chain configuration.  The  specificationVersion specifies the changedSet object for all information which uses the property object to specify the action on each information object. The Post/version/publish message is published when any data object in the schema is created, changed and deleted. The Post/version/undo message is used to reverse a specified version or changed data set of any previous published versions. The DM Administraion API provides Developers the Get/version messages to query for specific specification versions.  The DM function services production and support operations by managing all Level 3 and some Level 2 information definition.The DM specifications are sent to and then applied by other Level 3 functions and Level 2 functions. DM Administration includes management of the distribution of DM specifications to systems across L2-L4. The primary work definition object is the work master which is the requirements for a work task.  Each work master (ISA-95 Part 4) has a defined scope to an equipment heirachy level as either general, site, work cell, unit or lower. Some of the product production rule sets as equipment and process production rule sets may exist in Level 2 controllers and devices. When that is the case, exchanges of this L2 information shall be coordinated with production execution management and data collection management activities DM information is used by production execution management function to provide operational commands to L2 equipment controllers and devices; the operational commands provides as the workflow specification is executed per the job order.      The specificationVersion include message metadata elements as sequenceNumber, creationTimestamp, published, publicationTimestamp, comments, and changeSet. The changeSet object may contain the following objects of equipmentClasses, equipmentClassProperties, equipment, equipmentProperties, materialClasses, materialClassProperties, materialDefinitions, materialDefinitionProperties, materialLots, materialLotProperties; materialSublots; materialSublotProperties, personnelClasses, personnelClassProperties, persons, personProperties, testSpecifications; testSpecificationProperties; testSpecificationCriteria, evaluatedProperties; workMasters, workflowSpecifications, workflowSpecificationProperties, workflowSpecificationNode, workflowSpecificationNodeProperties, workflowSpecificationNodeTypes, workflowSpecificationNodeTypesProperties, workflowSpecificationConnections, workflowSpecificationConnectionProperties, workflowSpecificationConnectionTypes, workflowSpecificationConnectionTypeProperties, equipmentSpecifications, equipmentSpecificationProperties, materialSpecifications, materialSpecificationProperties, personnelSpecifications, personnelSpecificationProperties, parameterSpecifications, workRecordSpecifications, workRecordTemplates, workRecordEntryTemplates, workAlertDefinitions, workAlertDefinitionProperties, workAlertTemplates, and workAlertTemplateProperties.
info.title: Definition Management Administration API

get.summary: gets spec versions with specific numbers.
get.description: Gets specification versions with particular IDs.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: Version number for various work specifications.

post.summary: publishes a version of a work specfication.
post.description: Publishes a work specification of a particular version.

parameters.name: comments
parameters.description: Comments to attach to the publication.

post.summary: undo an unpublished version of a work specification.
post.description: Undo a work specification of a particular version.

get.summary: gets versions depending on their status.
get.description: Gets work specification versions depending on their properties.

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: Whether the versions have been published or not

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: The maximum creation date to search for

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: The minimum creation date to search for

parameters.name: publishedBefore
parameters.description: The maximum publication date to search for

parameters.name: publishedAfter
parameters.description: The minimum publication date to search for

creationTimestamp.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23

publicationTimestamp.example: ISO 8601: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss for local time as 2002-09-22T09:15:23
